Hi Ron,

 

The method of attaching menuki to the handle went from the male=
-female posts
or iny=F4kon that passed through the handle and the nakago fa=
stening the
menuki to each other to chikara-gane. These iny=F4kon posts con=
tinued until
the late Muromachi period into the Momoyama period. They are a=
lso seen on
generally high class works for the mid to late Edo period; howe=
ver, they no
longer went all the way through the tsuka and basically worked=
 as the newer
chikara-gane do. As noted, strength and metal is the literal =
translation,
but more accurately I would call them reinforced/strengthened =
tabs of
typically copper. On an added note, at least the first three genera=
tions of
the main line Goto masters are said to have only used iny=F4kon po=
sts and
menuki without them will typically be attributed to Ko-Goto rather =
than one
of the main guys. I expect we will be catching up with many on the=
 list in
San Francisco next month. I am certainly looking forward to it.
